undercut.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to sell goods or a service at a lower price than another company
undercut.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Online bookstores can undercut retailers by up to 30%.
undercut.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make something weaker or less effective
undercut.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Is a lack of self-confidence undercutting your performance at work?
undercut.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to sell goods or services more cheaply than another company
undercut.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Our competitors have been undercutting our prices.
The firm that expands output will always be able to reduce costs and undercut its rivals.
